title: Public records request CPAC Norfolk County/Case-Theresa Corley

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

State Police Personnel & Evidence Transfer Request
TO: Records Access Officer (RAO), Massachusetts State Police
RE: Public Records Request – CPAC Norfolk County / Case Theresa Corley Bellingham MA (1978-79)

To the Records Access Officer:

Pursuant to the Massachusetts Public Records Law (M.G.L. c. 66, § 10), I am requesting the following records regarding the investigative team assigned to the Dec. 1978 homicide of Theresa Corley in Bellingham, MA:

The Duty Roster / Personnel List: A list of all State Police officers assigned to the Norfolk County CPAC Unit between December 1, 1978, and February 28, 1979.

The Evidence Transfer Receipt (The "Blue Slip"): Any record, ledger entry, or receipt documenting the transfer of biological evidence (swabs/slides) from the Bellingham Police Department to the State Police during this period.

Command Structure: The name of the Commanding Officer (CO) or Lieutenant-in-Charge of the Norfolk CPAC unit at the time of the investigation.

Evidence Storage Logs: Records identifying the specific facility where Norfolk County homicide evidence was transported for "secondary storage" or "testing" in early 1979 (e.g., the 1010 Commonwealth Ave Lab or the Southern Mortuary).

Please note: While personnel files are often protected, Duty Rosters and Command Structures are public records. I am seeking these names to identify the chain of custody for evidence that has been erroneously labeled as "lost in a fire."

I also request that, if appropriate, fees be waived as we believe this request is in the public interest, as suggested but not stipulated by the recommendations of the Massachusetts Supervisor of Public Records. The requested documents will be made available to the general public free of charge as part of the public information service at MuckRock.com, and is not made for commercial usage.

I expect the request to be filled in an accessible format, including for screen readers, which provide text-to-speech for persons unable to read print. Files that are not accessible to screen readers include, for example, .pdf image files as well as physical documents.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

GERALDINE HOUDE

title: Public Records Request – Position Descriptions, Duties, Delegations of Authority, and other Related Information

communications.subject: Oregon Public Records Law Request: Public Records Request – Position Descriptions, Duties, Delegations of Authority, and other Related Information
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I am submitting this request under Oregon Public Records Law (ORS 192.311–192.478).

I request records sufficient to show the official position descriptions, assigned duties, reporting relationships, delegated authority, and other related information for the university positions performing the functions listed below. These requests concern the institutional roles themselves, not the personnel files of any individual employees.

1. Requested Positions / Functions:

  A. School of Music and Dance
   - Dean
   - Associate Dean for Finance and Operations
   - Director of Finance and Operations (Oregon Bach Festival area/department)
   - Director of Programming and Administration (Oregon Bach Festival area/department)

 B. Office of Investigations and Civil Rights Compliance (OEOA, including the ADA Coordinator)
    - Associate Vice President, Chief Civil Rights Officer, & Title IX Coordinator
    - Director of Investigations and Chief Deputy Title IX Coordinator
    - Investigator
    - Senior Investigator
    - Data Analyst & Case Coordinator
    - Intake and Resource Coordinator
    - Assistant Director & Accommodations Coordinator
    - Interim Investigations and Accommodations Coordinator
    - Deputy for Lundquist College of Business Associate Dean Lundquist College of Business
    - Positions performing investigator functions, including full time investigators, and Title IX Officers that have other roles within the University.
    - Records defining investigative authority, responsibilities, and reporting structure

 C. Office of Human Resources (HR, HR Leaves, ELR, etc)
   - Vice President and Chief Human Resources Officer
   - Executive Assistant and Strategic Initiatives Coordinator
   - Chief of Staff and Senior Director of HR Programs & Services
   - Senior Director, Employee and Labor Relations
   - Associate Director, Employee and Labor Relations
   - ELR Coordinator
   - Associate Director of Benefits
   - Senior Leaves Coordinator
   - Leaves Coordinator 

 D. Office of General Counsel (excluding privileged legal advice)
   - Vice President and General Counsel 
   - Sr. Associate General Counsel 
   - Associate General Counsel 

 E. Central Business Services Office
   - Senior Associate Dean, Academic Operations
   - Accounting Technician

 F. Risk Management
   - Occupational Health and Safety Manager
   - Occupational Safety Officer
   - Youth Program Safety Coordinator
   - Risk Specialist
   
 G. Public Records Office
   - Public Records Officer
   - University Records Manager

 H. Office of Internal Audit
   - Chief Auditor

 I. Information Services 
   - Digital Accessibility Architect
  
 J. Office of Business Affairs
   - Director Financial Services
   - Senior Tax Accountant/Analyst
   - Accounts Payable Manager
   - Travel Manager
   
 K. Purchasing and Contracting Services
   - Chief Procurement Officer
   - Associate Director of Contracting
   - Contract Administrator
   - Contracts Officer
   - Contracts Technician 2

 L. Other Positions:
   - President of University of Oregon 
   - Vice President for Equity and Inclusion

2. Regarding #1 (A) from above, School of Music and Dance (including the Oregon Bach Festival department/area), please provide records from January 1, 2016 to present sufficient to show:
   - Organizational charts reflecting reporting structure within the School of Music and Dance and Oregon Bach Festival
   - Changes in reporting relationships, including records showing when positions were reassigned from one Officer of Administration or supervisory structure to another, and any contemporaneous documentation describing the basis for those 
     changes
   - Records reflecting reassignment of duties, changes in unit structure, or redistribution of operational responsibilities associated with those changes, including records showing coordination, consultation, or involvement with other university 
      offices (such as central administration, HR, ELR, OEOA, Central Business Services Office, or Risk Management) in planning, reviewing, or implementing those actions
   - Documents prepared in the course of evaluating, recommending, approving, or implementing restructuring, including memoranda, presentations, financial analyses, or planning materials
   - Records reflecting creation, elimination, reclassification, funding-source changes, reorganization, or reassignment of positions associated with the Oregon Bach Festival or School of Music and Dance as part of these organizational changes

3. For each position listed in #1 (A-L) above, I request records sufficient to show:
   - Official job descriptions or classification specifications
   - The administrative, fiscal, and supervisory responsibilities assigned to these positions
   - Statements of essential duties and responsibilities
   - Documents reflecting delegated authority or decision-making scope
   - Organizational charts identifying reporting structure and structural relationships among these offices
   - Written guidance, manuals, or internal documents describing how these roles coordinate or maintain separation of responsibilities
   - Any revisions to these materials during the period January 1, 2023 to present 
   - Unless otherwise specified above, this portion of the request covers the period January 1, 2023 to present.

 4. In addition to the materials requested above in #1 (A–L), please provide records sufficient to show how workplace matters requiring coordination among supervisory units and central administrative offices were received, routed, and assigned 
     for action from January 1, 2019 to present, including records describing the respective roles and responsibilities of Human Resources (including HR Leaves and Employee & Labor Relations), Workplace ADA, OEOA (including investigators and 
     accommodations personnel), supervisory personnel within departments, and other involved administrative offices. This includes, but is not limited to:
    - Documents describing intake, receipt, or “ingestion” processes for concerns raised to supervisors or unit leadership and how those matters were documented, tracked, or transmitted to central offices
    - Any written guidance identifying designated reporting or escalation duties of supervisors, administrators, HR personnel, ADA personnel, investigators, or other staff, including when they were expected or required to notify or involve offices        
     such as Workplace ADA, HR, Employee & Labor Relations, OEOA, Risk Management, or the Office of General Counsel
    - Documents describing required reporting, mandatory disclosure, or notice obligations triggered when supervisors or administrators became aware of workplace concerns, including instructions regarding when the institution was considered 
     to have received notice and what actions were required following such notice
    - Workflows, routing charts, training materials, responsibility matrices, or procedural instructions describing how such matters were handled at the unit level versus referred to central administration
    - Records reflecting changes to these intake, reporting, notice, routing, or coordination responsibilities during this period
    - Records sufficient to show how the University implemented, communicated, or revised practices related to statutory notice requirements under ORS 659A.279 and ORS 659A.283, including any internal guidance, postings, policies, training 
     materials, or administrative instructions addressing those requirements
    - Materials used to implement or communicate those changes, including memoranda, presentations, administrative guidance, or revisions to internal procedures
    - This request seeks structural and procedural records only and does not request information contained in individual personnel, medical, or complaint files.
    - This timeframe is intended to capture records reflecting implementation or operational effects of policy and process changes occurring around 2021.

This request does not seek:
- Performance evaluations
- Disciplinary records
- Medical or personal information
- Any content maintained solely within individual personnel or supervisory files

If any portion of the requested records is withheld, please provide the specific statutory exemption relied upon and a description of the withheld material as required by ORS 192.345(2).

I request a waiver or reduction of any fees associated with this request on the grounds that the records are sought to understand the organization and operation of a public institution and are not requested for commercial purposes.

If responsive records exist in electronic form, I request they be provided electronically.

Clarification Regarding Parallel Processes:

This public records request is submitted solely pursuant to Oregon Public Records Law and is independent of any other employment-related processes. It does not waive, limit, replace, or otherwise affect any requests, grievances, or RFIs submitted through my union or other channels, many of which remain pending.

This request is made to obtain access to public records necessary to understand the structure and operation of university processes and to inform my planning. The public records process is the appropriate statutory mechanism for obtaining this information.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kelvin Shivers II

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Texas Public Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

In 2018 a series of bombings were perpetuated by Mark Anthony Conditt. The investigation involved the FBI, Austin Police Department, and the Texas Department of Public Safety. I am requesting 

- Audio or direct transcription of the 25 minute video recording my Mark Anthony Conditt as referenced by Governor Greg Abbot and former Austin Police chief Brian Manley -
 https://web.archive.org/web/20180323120234/https://www.statesman.com/news/breaking-austin-bombing-suspect-dies-police-close-official-says/KZmUAGvKlNazDr31EzeUzI/
https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/morning-mix/wp/2018/03/22/austin-bomber-challenged-young-man-or-terrorist/

- Any documents relating to the investigation, identification, or pursuit of Mark Anthony Conditt

- Any documents regarding a follow up investigation on any groups or associates of Mark Anthony Conditt. 

I ask that the fee be waived as this information is within the public interest and many documents were widely commented on despite them not being available to the public (namely the 25 minute recording) release and access of this information is crucial to fair and accurate reporting on this matter.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nate Zaffiro

title: 1963 FDA Raid on Founding Church of Scientology (Department of Justice, United States Marshals)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Freedom of Information Act, I hereby request the following records:

- Any and all documents in your possession pertaining to the investigation or execution of the 1963 Raid on the Founding Church of Scientology 

- Any and all documents in your possession regarding the Founding Church of Scientology



This event is public knowledge and of public knowledge. Listed below are publications, legal rulings, or academic works who reference the raid.

Food and Drug Administration, FDA Church of Scientology/E-Meter Files (n.d.), accessed February 4, 2026, http://archive.org/details/FDAScientology.

“Interview with William W. Goodrich--Part 2,” accessed February 6, 2026, https://web.archive.org/web/20040219095225/ttp://www.fda.gov/oc/history/oralhistories/goodrich/part2.html#scientology.

Scientology and the FDA:  A Look Back, A Modern Analysis, And A New Approach, n.d.

Paul Horwitz, “Scientology in Court: A Comparative Analysis and Some Thoughts on Selected Issues in Law and Religion,” DePaul L. Rev. 47 (January 1997): 85.

Stuart A. Wright and Susan J. Palmer, “The Church of Scientology,” in Storming Zion: Government Raids on Religious Communities, ed. Stuart A. Wright and Susan J. Palmer (Oxford University Press, 2016), https://doi.org/10.1093/acprof:oso/9780195398892.003.0008.

Hubbard Dianetics Research Foundation Charles Leonard, AMA Files Given To FDA Exhibit 9 Challenge From L. Ron Hubbard To Psychiatry Menninger February 12 1951 (1951), http://archive.org/details/amafilesgiventofdaexhibit9challengefroml.ronhubbardtopsychiatrymenningerfebruary121951.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 20 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Nate Zaffiro

title: Transgender Healthcare for ICE Detainees in Contracted Jail Facilities

communications.subject: The Kansas Open Records Act Request: Transgender Healthcare for ICE Detainees in Contracted Jail Facilities
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the The Kansas Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

For the period of January 1, 2023, until whenever this request is fulfilled, I request access to and copies of the following records concerning the provision of medical and mental health care to transgender individuals housed in your facility under contracts or agreements with U.S. Immigration and Customs Enforcement (ICE). Specifically:

1. Policies, procedures, protocols or training materials regarding gender-affirming medical or mental healthcare, hormone therapy continuation or initiation, housing,  classification or medical accommodations for transgender detainees.
2. Communications (including emails, letters, meeting notes) between your agency and ICE or ICE contractors, the Kansas Department of Health and Environment, or any county/state officials regarding compliance with Kansas Senate Bill 63 (“Help Not Harm Act”) or any limits on government funding or provision of transgender-related medical treatment.
3. Contracts, intergovernmental agreements, statements of work, or amendments between your agency and ICE that address medical care responsibilities and standards applicable to transgender detainees.
4. Grievances, complaints, incident reports, or internal reviews relating to alleged denial, delay, or modification of transgender-related medical care for ICE detainees.
5. Invoices, billing records, or reimbursement documentation showing whether gender-affirming care was approved, denied, or excluded from payment.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 3 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

JasmineLewin

title: Financial Report Request (University of Tennessee, Knoxville)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Tennessee Public Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

1) I would like a copy of the annual NCAA MFRS report for FY2017 - FY2025. These annual reports are submitted by the athletic department and record the revenue/expenses of the department. It is an approximately 90 page document listing revenue and expenses in the athletic department by team. It is a standard annual NCAA form. The latest FY2025 report was due, 1/15/2025 so should be available. If you are unable to include this, can you please specify if you will send it to me immediately when it's available or if you want me to make a new request. That should be 9 reports combined.

2) I'd like copies of the latest contracts for your athletic director and head coaches of football, mens/womens basketball, and mens/womens ice hockey if you have those teams. That should be 6 documents if you have that many teams.

Please let me know if you have any questions. Thank you for your time.

Best,

Greg Chick

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

Sincerely,

Kent Hoover, a citizen of Tennessee, in coordination with Greg Chick.

title: Public Records Request – Yearly Administration of University-Administered Safe Leave (ORS 659A)

communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Oregon Public Records Law, I hereby request the following records:

I request records concerning how the University of Oregon has administered University-administered safe leave under ORS 659A.270–659A.285 from January 1, 2016 to the present.

This request is limited to situations in which the University itself evaluated, approved, denied, limited, or redirected leave for ORS 659A-qualifying purposes. I am not requesting personally identifying information.

Please provide the following, organized by calendar year (2016–present):

1. The total number of requests for University-administered safe leave (paid, unpaid, or in conjunction with accrued leave), broken down by:

   - qualifying purpose category under ORS 659A.272, and
   - outcome (approved, denied, redirected to another leave category, delayed, or otherwise modified).

2. For any denials, delays, or redirections, records sufficient to show:

   - the year of the determination,
   - the qualifying purpose category under ORS 659A.272, and
   - the stated reason for the denial, delay, limitation, or redirection.

3. Any aggregate summaries, tracking records, or reports the University maintains that reflect how ORS 659A University-administered safe leave has been administered over time.

4. Identification of where the University has posted or maintained the notices required under ORS 659A.279 and ORS 659A.283, including:

   - physical posting locations,
   - electronic locations where those notices have been made available to employees (including remote employees), and
   - the dates those notices were in effect at those locations.

5. Any records, guidance, training materials, or communications indicating that:

   - certain qualifying purposes were treated as atypical or outside normal use,
   - eligibility was evaluated based on the nature of the allegation or proceeding rather than the statutory criteria, or
   - certification from a health-care or service provider was considered insufficient under ORS 659A.280.

6. A year-by-year numerical summary of the number of times the University notified complainants who alleged they were victims of conduct covered by ORS 659A.272 of the availability of University-administered safe leave protections, as required under the notice obligations set forth in ORS 659A.279 and ORS 659A.283, including:

    - the office providing the notice (e.g., OEOA/OICRC, Human Resources, HR Leaves, Workplace ADA, Employee & Labor Relations, or other),
    - the category of qualifying conduct or bias identified (reported only by category and count),
    - any records or aggregate data reflecting whether notification or access to safe leave was tracked, administered, or categorized differently based on the type of alleged bias (for example, disability-related complaints, ADA retaliation, race,       
       sex/gender, or other protected categories), and
    - any aggregate records reflecting how or when such notice was provided as part of complaint or response processes pursuant to ORS 659A.279 and ORS 659A.283.


Names and identifying details are not requested and may be redacted.

Clarification regarding parallel processes:

To avoid any confusion, this public records request is submitted pursuant to Oregon Public Records Law only and does not waive, replace, or otherwise affect any requests, grievances, or RFIs I have submitted through my union or any other employment-related process, many of which remain pending.

This request is submitted because I require timely access to records necessary to understand my statutory protections and to plan accordingly. The public records process is the only mechanism currently available to obtain this information within a reasonable timeframe.

Please provide the records electronically. If the information is maintained in summary or report form, those summaries are sufficient.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 10 business days.

Sincerely,

Kelvin Shivers II

title: Autopsy report for Baby Bennett of Booneville

communications.subject: Kentucky Open Records Act Request: Autopsy report for Baby Bennett of Booneville
communications.communication:
To Whom It May Concern:

Pursuant to the Kentucky Open Records Act, I hereby request the following records:

I'm a reporter seeking the autopsy report for the fetus related to Deeann Bennett and Charles Bennett of Booneville, who were indicted in January 2026 and arrested in February 2026.

The state is pressing charges without releasing information about the estimated gestational age of the fetus, which is relevant to the charges at hand. 

State police referred to the fetus as an "infant" and a "baby" in its press releases (https://www.kentuckystatepolice.ky.gov/news/p7-11-29-2024) and that language is showing up in news coverage of the incident, which could prejudice a potential jury and harm the defendants' reputation and financial standing.

This report is a matter of public interest.

The requested documents will be made available to the general public, and this request is not being made for commercial purposes.

In the event that there are fees, I would be grateful if you would inform me of the total charges in advance of fulfilling my request. I would prefer the request filled electronically, by e-mail attachment if available or CD-ROM if not.

Thank you in advance for your anticipated cooperation in this matter. I look forward to receiving your response to this request within 5 business days, as the statute requires.

Sincerely,

Susan Rinkunas

2. 2024 Nov General Election

Specifically, for each of these elections, I’m looking for the full anonymized record of votes cast in Routt County that is generated by the voting system.
